text: Looking for experience over degree (3+ years)

u: Has knowledge of Oxford Nanopore sequencing and bioinformatics

p.2: =E2=80=A2 Proficiency in C/C++, R, Python, WSL2, scripting
p.4: =E2=80=A2 Has previously worked on IT, web applications, API management, or software engineering
p.5: =E2=80=A2 Has experience with data science, machine learning, or automation
p.8: =E2=80=A2 Ability to organize and execute experiments
p.9: =E2=80=A2 Has a proven ability to organize and tabulate data
p.12: Insight Global is seeking a candidate to join a well-known pharmaceutical company and help with the data correlated with experiments in a hybrid work environment. Set up and maintain a computational workstation and/or VM for Oxford Nanopore Technologies sequence analysis, QC, assembly, and alignment. Perform bioinformatic/signal processing on Nanopore DNA and RNA outputs. Validate and compare existing sequencing software packages and then tailor those libraries for mRNA vaccine-specific and novel QC use cases. Look to the future by evaluating coming changes to Nanopore kits/reagents/data filetypes and their potential impact on current workflows. Create documentation and pipelines aimed towards bench scientists who have minimal computer science familiarity. Must perform experiments in a meticulous & timely manner. Incumbent assists senior researchers in the evaluation of new technologies for the group. Gains understanding of the discipline through reading of the scientific literature. Presents data summaries within the group. Fully documents experimental results in notebooks in a timely and compliant manner.
